---
title: "Neighborhood Choice and Segregation"
---

## Overview

This lecture examines how people choose neighborhoods and why cities exhibit residential segregation by race and income. We'll explore models of sorting and tipping, and analyze the causes and consequences of segregation.

## Key Topics

- Patterns of segregation
  - Measuring segregation (dissimilarity index, isolation index)
  - Historical trends in racial segregation
  - Income segregation
  - Geographic variation

- Causes of segregation
  - Individual preferences and sorting
  - Schelling's tipping model
  - Discrimination in housing markets
  - Historical policies (redlining, restrictive covenants)
  - Income inequality and housing costs

- Consequences of segregation
  - Access to opportunities
  - School quality disparities
  - Network effects
  - Neighborhood amenities
  - Political consequences
